documentation.content:
## Use RDJSONL format for streaming diagnostics

```bash
# Output one diagnostic per line (JSONL)
./linter --output=jsonl | reviewdog -f=rdjsonl -reporter=github-pr-check

# Example: Convert multiple findings to rdjsonl
for file in *.go; do
  echo "{\"message\":\"File $file needs review\",\"location\":{\"path\":\"$file\",\"range\":{\"start\":{\"line\":1}}},\"severity\":\"INFO\"}"
done | reviewdog -f=rdjsonl -reporter=local
```

## Protocol Buffers Linting with reviewdog Action

```yaml
# Example for Protolint
- name: Run Protolint
  uses: yoheimuta/action-protolint@master
  with:
    # ... protolint specific inputs
```

## Running ESLint with reviewdog and Diff Filtering (Shell)

```shell
golint ./... | reviewdog -f=golint -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD"
```

## CircleCI Configuration for reviewdog

```yaml
version: 2
jobs:
  build:
    docker:
      - image: golang:latest
    steps:
      - checkout
      - run: curl -sfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/reviewdog/reviewdog/fd59714416d6d9a1c0692d872e38e7f8448df4fc/install.sh| sh -s -- -b ./bin
      - run: go vet ./... 2>&1 | ./bin/reviewdog -f=govet -reporter=github-pr-review

      # Deprecated: prefer GitHub Actions to use github-pr-check reporter.
      - run: go vet ./... 2>&1 | ./bin/reviewdog -f=govet -reporter=github-pr-check
```

## RDFormat DiagnosticResult Message in JSON

```json
{
  "source": {
    "name": "super lint",
    "url": "https://example.com/url/to/super-lint"
  },
  "severity": "WARNING",
  "diagnostics": [
    {
      "message": "<msg>",
      "location": {
        "path": "<file path>",
        "range": {
          "start": {
            "line": 14,
            "column": 15
          }
        }
      },
      "severity": "ERROR",
      "code": {
        "value": "RULE1",
        "url": "https://example.com/url/to/super-lint/RULE1"
      }
    },
    {
      "message": "<msg>",
      "location": {
        "path": "<file path>",
        "range": {
          "start": {
            "line": 14,
            "column": 15
          },
          "end": {
            "line": 14,
            "column": 18
          }
        }
      },
      "suggestions": [
        {
          "range": {
            "start": {
              "line": 14,
              "column": 15
            },
            "end": {
              "line": 14,
              "column": 18
            }
          },
          "text": "<replacement text>"
        }
      ],
      "severity": "WARNING"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Kotlin Code Analysis with reviewdog Action

```yaml
# Example for Ktlint
- name: Run Ktlint
  uses: ScaCap/action-ktlint@master
  with:
    # ... ktlint specific inputs
```

## Parse linter output with predefined format (Go)

```bash
# Run golint and pipe to reviewdog with local reporter
golint ./... | reviewdog -f=golint -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD"

# Output example:
# comment_iowriter.go:11:6: [golint] exported type CommentWriter should have comment or be unexported

# List all available predefined formats
reviewdog -list

# Output includes formats like:
# golint          linter for Go source code                                       - https://github.com/golang/lint
# govet           Vet examines Go source code and reports suspicious problems     - https://golang.org/cmd/vet/
# eslint          The pluggable linting utility for JavaScript and JSX            - https://eslint.org/
```

## RDFormat Diagnostic Message in JSON Lines

```json
{"message": "<msg>", "location": {"path": "<file path>", "range": {"start": {"line": 14, "column": 15}}}, "severity": "ERROR"}
{"message": "<msg>", "location": {"path": "<file path>", "range": {"start": {"line": 14, "column": 15}, "end": {"line": 14, "column": 18}}}, "suggestions": [{"range": {"start": {"line": 14, "column": 15}, "end": {"line": 14, "column": 18}}, "text": "<replacement text>"}], "severity": "WARNING"}
...
```

## Using Pre-defined Errorformats with reviewdog

```shell
$ reviewdog -list
golint          linter for Go source code                                       - https://github.com/golang/lint
govet           Vet examines Go source code and reports suspicious problems     - https://golang.org/cmd/vet/
sbt             the interactive build tool                                      - http://www.scala-sbt.org/
...
$ golint ./... | reviewdog -f=golint -diff="git diff FETCH_HEAD"
```

## Travis CI Integration with reviewdog (github-pr-review)

```shell
$ gem install travis
$ travis encrypt REVIEWDOG_GITHUB_API_TOKEN=<token> --add env.global
```

## Travis CI Integration with reviewdog (github-pr-review)

```yaml
env:
  global:
    - secure: <token>

install:
  - mkdir -p ~/bin/ && export PATH="~/bin/:$PATH"
  - curl -sfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/reviewdog/reviewdog/fd59714416d6d9a1c0692d872e38e7f8448df4fc/install.sh| sh -s -- -b ~/bin

script:
  - >-
    golint ./... | reviewdog -f=golint -reporter=github-pr-review
```
